intro: Euphoebe chartacea, commonly known as the chartaceous euphoebe, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurel trees and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, chart-like leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Euphoebe chartacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
